Key Match Events: Matt Wallner hit a solo home run in the first inning
Brooks Lee snapped an 0-for-19 stretch with a go-ahead, two-run double
Royce Lewis nearly hit a sixth career grand slam but it was initially called a home run but reviewed to a two-run double
Post-Match Reflections: Minnesota has back-to-back wins after losing six of its previous seven games
Minnesota remains six games behind Cleveland and 1 1/2 behind Kansas City in the AL Central
They are three ahead of Detroit for the final AL wild-card spot
Miscellaneous Highlights: Taylor Ward led off the game with his 23rd homer
Willi Castro had an RBI single to snap an 0-for-16 skid during a three-run fourth inning
Nolan Schanuel had his 13th homer of the season
Jordyn Adams added his first career homer for Los Angeles
Others: Angels' INF Brandon Drury left the game in the fifth inning with left hamstring tightness
Manager Ron Washington said OF Bryce Teodosio sustained a small finger fracture on a bunt attempt a night earlier
Minnesota OF Byron Buxton will be activated from the 10-day injured list prior to Friday's game against Cincinnati
OF Manuel Margot was reinstated from the injured list after missing 10 games with a right groin strain
C Jair Camargo and utility player Michael Helman were optioned to Triple-A
